results.title: Stars of the Russian ballet
results.brief_description: Sovexportfilm Australia presents this historic feature length production made in 1953 and beautifully preserved. It is a compilation of three ballets, featuring both world famous Kirov and Bolshoi Ballets. The first of the three ballets is Tchaikovsky’s “Swan Lake” with Galina Ulanova as the beautiful White Swan - Odette, and the outstanding Natalya Dudinskaya as the rivalling Black Swan - Odile. The second ballet is “The Fountains of Bakchisarai” based on the poem by Alexander Pushkin and starring the internationally acclaimed Maya Plisetskaya as the seductive Zarema and Galina Ulanova as the tragic Maria. The final ballet is “The Flames of Paris” the breathtaking tale of the French Revolution, with magnificent sets and costumes and one of the largest casts ever assembled for a ballet.

results.title: Stark
results.creator_credit: Nadia Tass, Timothy White, David Parker, Michael Wearing, Film Victoria and Cascade Ash
results.brief_description: Stark, the most powerful secret society on Earth could buy the Earth a thousand times and still make a takeover bid on God. So why is Stark desperate to buy a large slab of Aboriginal land in the Australian outback? CD, (Ben Elton), doesn’t care about the world, but he does care about getting laid, especially by Rachel, (Jacqueline McKenzie), a beautiful rebel looking for a cause. Together with Zimmerman and Walter, two Vietnam veterans, dippy hippy Karen and Christie Kettel, a New York journalist, they take on Stark to try and save the world from a toxic conspiracy. Filmed entirely in Australia, Stark combines Ben Elton’s brash, individual humour with a serious environmental message.

results.title: Star Wars
results.creator_credit: George Lucas, Gary Kurtz, Lucasfilm, Ltd. and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A Long time ago in a galaxy far far away, George Lucas’s space adventure captured the hearts and imaginations of film lovers of all ages from the moment these words scrolled across the screen. The Empire’s evil Death Star must be destroyed. The heroes, Luke Skywalker, Princess Leia, Han Solo and a pair of droids named R2-D2 and C-3PO, as part of the Rebel Alliance, must pit their strength against the might of the Empire and the evil Jedi, Darth Vader. With the help of an old Jedi Knight, Obi-Wan Kenobi, they battle the forces of darkness and triumph. The special effects and famous “Star wars” theme music has ensured that this film takes its place in cinema history. Includes a ten minute interview between George Lucas and Leonard Maltin.

constellations_other.name: The Wilhelm scream, easters eggs and open world games
constellations_other.description: This Constellation tracks how an on-set in-joke became one of the first cinematic easter eggs. It was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Harrison Buikstra and Jasper Caverly.

constellations_other.name: Eighties hunks
constellations_other.description: Thor’s hero costume from Thor: Love and Thunder was inspired by classic comics of the 80s. Gone are the military greys, replaced with bright golds and bold colours. Let’s take a look at the lineage of 80s action heroes to which this version of Thor belongs.

results.title: Star wars (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Princess Leia is captured by the evil imperial forces in their efforts to take over the galactic Empire. Venturesome Luke Skywalker and dashing space captain Han Solo team together with the lovable Droids C-3PO and R2D2 to restore justice to the universe.

results.title: Mr. & Mrs. Edgehill (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Gavin Millar, Alan Shallcross, Arts and Entertainment Network, Quintet Films and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Star Quality : The Stories of Noel Coward”.
Lady Cynthia is a woman of wealth and position, but she is touched and amazed at the love and devotion Mr. and Mrs. Edgehill feel for one another. What is it that makes this ordinary couple so content with their life - even on a remote and desolate South Sea island. Starring Judi Dench and Ian Holm and adapted from a story by Noel Coward.
